creator: apache.org@schildbach.de
text:
my enhancement idea is to include a flag to suppress the output of the task 
names (presently printed in brackets). this should be possible on task by task 
basis.
Do you know about the -emacs flag?
creator: conor@apache.org
apache.org@schildbach.de
text:
Sorry, I did not know about that flag.
However, I would like to switch off the adornments on a per-task-basis ("java" 
and "exec" would be enough for me).
And I'd like to stick that setting to a specific project (build.xml) and not a 
specific installation of Ant (ant.bat/ant.sh).

Since this is a very user-specific request, how about simply creating your own 
custom BuildLogger and use that instead of having something like this added to 
Ant's core?
creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
text:
Marking as WONTFIX since this is a highly user-specific request. A custom 
BuildLogger would do the trick - and if you build one generic enough please 
consider submitting back to ant-dev if you feel its generally useful to others.
